org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple

Class SimpleRiverFlow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple.SimpleRiverFlow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, RiverFlow
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OneShotRiverFlow, TableRiverFlow

    public class SimpleRiverFlow
extends Object
implements RiverFlow
    A river flow implementation for the 'simple' strategy.

    This river flow runs fetch actions in a loop and waits before the next cycle begins.

    A version counter is incremented each time a fetch move is executed.

    A checksum is computed over the fetched data. If it differs between runs, it is assumed the data has changed, and a houskeeper is run to clean up the documents which have a smaller version than the river state.

    The state of the river flow is saved between runs. So, in case of a restart, the river flow will recover with the last known state of the river.

    Author:
    JÃ¶rg Prante
